CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT (mentioned 5 times)
 * PSFDTBT is the alternating copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2',1',3'-benzothiadiazole unit.
2. PCBM (mentioned 2 times)
 * PCBM stands for poly[7,7,8,8-tetracyano-2,3,5,6-tetracyano-1,4-benzothiazole].
3. DCB (mentioned once)
 * DCB stands for dicyclopentadiene.
4. TCB (mentioned once)
 * TCB stands for tetracyano-crown-5.
5. PS (mentioned once)
 * PS stands for polystyrene.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT (mentioned 5 times)

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to Material Name:

* DCB
* TCB
* PS

Let me know if you have any further questions!

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Name entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT (Polystyrene-based Spirofluorene-Thienothiophene-Benzothiadiazole) - a donor polymer
2. PCBM (P-Type Silicon) - an acceptor material
3. PSFDTBT - a copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2',1',3'-benzothiadiazole
4. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital)
5. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital)
6. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
7. Open-circuit voltage (Voc)
8. Short-circuit current density (Jsc)
9. Film morphology
10. Device fabrication conditions

Note that some of these terms are used in a more general sense in the field of polymer solar cells, but they are specifically mentioned in the context of the materials and devices discussed in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

1. PSFDTBT (Polystyrene-based Spirofluorene-Thienothiophene-Benzothiadiazole) - a donor polymer
2. PCBM (P-Type Silicon) - an acceptor material
3. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital)
4. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital)
5. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
6. Open-circuit voltage (Voc)
7. Short-circuit current density (Jsc)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

| Property Name |
| --- |

| PCBM |
| HOMO |
| LUMO |
| PCE |

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. AFM height images:
* Root-mean-square (rms) value for blend films from DCB: 0.242 nm
* Root-mean-square (rms) value for blend films from TCB: 0.306 nm
2. Photovoltaic device performances: Not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
3. Electron and hole mobility of the active layer: Not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
4. Domain size of 10-20 nm for bicontinuous donor-acceptor network: Not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
5. HOMO / LUMO positions of PSFDTBT: Not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
6. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT: Not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
7. Open-circuit voltage (Voc) of polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM: 0.94 V.
8. Power conversion efficiency (PCE) of polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM: 4.6%.

Note that some of these values are mentioned in the context of the paragraph, while others are not.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. 0.242 nm (value of root-mean-square (rms) value for blend films from DCB)
2. 0.306 nm (value of root-mean-square (rms) value for blend films from TCB)
3. 4.6% (value of power conversion efficiency (PCE) of polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM)
